node.excerpt: Value Each of the input components in the Learn package accept a  value  prop. We can use this prop to set the initial value of the input, or to sync its value with another part of our project‚Äôs state. Different input components have values of‚Ä¶

A  NavigationBar  models the top navigation bar of an iOS app. The bar has a title, an optional subtitle, and two tappable areas on its left and right sides. Each of these areas may have a link, icon or both. The bar has a taller ‚Äúlarge‚Äù mode that‚Ä¶

A  Button  can display either text or an icon. It can be tapped and will run an  onTap  callback when tapped. It may optionally be toggled with each tap. Props Prop Type Default Notes text string "Get Started!‚Äù icon string ‚Äùnone" See  Icon  below‚Ä¶

A  CheckboxGroup  takes a set of options and turns them into a set of  RowItem s, each of which displays the option together with a  Checkbox . The CheckboxGroup‚Äôs value is an array containing all checked options. Props Prop Type Default Notes‚Ä¶

Tapping on a  Checkbox  will toggled it between on or off. Props Prop Type Default Notes value boolean false Whether the Checkbox is checked. disabled boolean false validation function (value) => true A callback that returns  true  or  false‚Ä¶
Tapping on a  Favorite  will toggle it between on and off. Props Prop Type Default Notes value boolean false onValueChange function (value) => void Examples

An  Icon  displays a Material Design Icon. Props Prop Type Default Notes icon string "camera‚Äù A Material Design Icon name. See  Icon  below. color string colors.Primary Any color. size number 24 The size of the icon. Icon The  icon  prop can accept‚Ä¶

An  Image  shows an image with an optional color overlay. It may also have a  Favorite . Props Prop Type Default Notes image string null A source URL for the Image's image. overlay boolean true color string colors.Primary A color to use for the image‚Ä¶
